name: ContentSyncDxpImportBlobsToAzure
friendlyName: Import DXP blobs to Azure (Optimizely DXP)
description: Content synchronizer - Import DXP blobs to a Azure storage account container. (Optimizely DXP)
author: Ove Lartelius
releaseNotes: v2.2.0: Run as node. Changed to use StorageAccountConnection.

inputs.name: DxpExportBlobsSasLink
inputs.label: SAS link / Blobs export SAS link
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SAS link to the blobs that you want to sync to Azure. Example: $(DxpExportBlobsSasLink). This value will be set automatically if you use task ExportBlobs.

inputs.name: StorageAccountConnection
inputs.label: Storage account connection string
inputs.helpMarkDown: The connection string to the destination storage account. Ex: DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;AccountName=mystorage;AccountKey=iRjboiZ3W7P/kwgu1oZboH0vWQwPU9E7C5NWHwATm1j87vzlykPaJ8rILigRCLbJRVVI/nLj2KX3ATWni7tYXg==;EndpointSuffix=core.windows.net

inputs.name: StorageAccountContainer
inputs.label: Storage Account Container
inputs.helpMarkDown: Storage account container where blobs will be copied to.

inputs.name: CleanBeforeCopy
inputs.label: Clean before copy
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you want the script to remove all blobs in destination container before we sync the blobs.

inputs.name: RunVerbose
inputs.label: Run Verbose
inputs.helpMarkDown: If tou want to run in verbose mode and see all information.

inputs.name: ErrorActionPreference
inputs.label: ErrorActionPreference
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prepends the line `$ErrorActionPreference = 'VALUE'` at the top of your script.
